meanings.definition: Predicts the future or foretells events.
meanings.sent1: The soothsays of the old wise woman were always accurate.
meanings.sent2: The town soothsays predicted a bountiful harvest for the coming year.
meanings.sent3: The soothsays at the fair predicted sunny weather for the weekend.
meanings.sent4: The soothsays of the fortune teller seemed to come true with each passing day.
meanings.sent5: The soothsays of the ancient oracle were whispered through the winds of time.

meanings.sent1: He soothsays that the team will win the championship this year.
meanings.sent2: The wise elder soothsays the arrival of a great leader.
meanings.sent3: The weatherman soothsays rain for the entire week.
meanings.sent4: She soothsays the outcome of every game before it even begins.
meanings.sent5: The prophet soothsays the rise and fall of kingdoms with unwavering accuracy.
